member.name: M:ubiLease.CommonControls.Code128Code.CodesForChar(System.Int32,System.Int32,ubiLease.CommonControls.CodeSet@)
member.summary: Get the Code128 code value(s) to represent an ASCII character, with optional look-ahead for length optimization
member.param: The ASCII value of the character to translate
The next character in sequence (or -1 if none)
The current codeset, that the returned codes need to follow; if the returned codes change that, then this value will be changed to reflect it
member.returns: An array of integers representing the codes that need to be output to produce the given character

member.name: M:ubiLease.CommonControls.Code128Code.CodesetAllowedForChar(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tells us which codesets a given character value is allowed in
member.param: ASCII value of character to look at
member.returns: Which codeset(s) can be used to represent this character

member.name: M:ubiLease.CommonControls.Code128Code.CharCompatibleWithCodeset(System.Int32,ubiLease.CommonControls.CodeSet)
member.summary: Determine if a character can be represented in a given codeset
member.returns: true if the codeset contains a representation for the ASCII character

member.name: M:ubiLease.CommonControls.Code128Code.CodeValueForChar(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the integer code128 code value for a character (assuming the appropriate code set)
member.returns: code128 symbol value for the character

member.name: M:ubiLease.CommonControls.Code128Code.StartCodeForCodeSet(ubiLease.CommonControls.CodeSet)
member.summary: Return the appropriate START code depending on the codeset we want to be in
member.param: The codeset you want to start in
member.returns: The code128 code to start a barcode in that codeset
